list_definition.definition: a (usually metal) movable lock with a U-shaped bar which can be passed through a ring, chain etc and locked

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has put a padlock on the gate.

list_ex_of_english: In 1975—these figures were supplied to me by one firm—over 2 million padlocks were imported.
There are entrances at the grilled (and padlocked where necessary) shafts at the edge of the outcrop.
There were no means of escape such as had been certified by the authorities; the security door was padlocked, and the key was missing.
The door could not be opened, as it was designed to open inwards and was padlocked.
However, couples decided to attach their padlocks elsewhere.
A radical solution was devised - a medicine trolley on wheels which could be securely padlocked to a wall when not in use.
We are working very hard to ensure that those padlocks do not appear.
A number of firms in my constituency manufacture padlocks.
